lead_paragraph: An international commission’s call for an investigation into a 2006 crackdown, ordered by Enrique Peña Nieto when he was governor, is a new blow to his presidency.

headline.print_headline: Mexico Case May Deal Hit to Presidency
headline.main: Police Sex Abuse Case Is Bad News for Mexico’s Leader

snippet: An international commission’s call for an investigation into a 2006 crackdown, ordered by Enrique Peña Nieto when he was governor, is a new blow to his presidency....
abstract: Inter-American Commission on Human Rights demands investigation into sexual torture of 11 Mexican women by police after they were arrested during 2006 protest in San Salvador Atenco; revelations deal another blow to already rocky presidency of Pres Enrique Pena Nieto, who as governor of town at time of protests, had ordered crackdown on demonstrators and then undermined women's claims for justice; survivors express hopes of bringing attackers to justice so they can move forward from traumatic ordeal.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
